text: Hi everyone I'm Miguel from HubSnacks. I'm researching a potential integration with HubSpot and Woocommerce and getting up to speed with Ecommerce Bridge. Api seems great but I have a question - if I generate a sale on Woocommerce via an ad (say FB or Google), and sync this sale to HubSpot, will I be able to attribute this sale to advertising in HubSpot. I cannot see anything in the EB documentation that refers to tracking ad spend. Any insights will be really appreciated! Thanks :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi <@U034MLH1BC2>, my name is umakant and i works at makewebbetter, co-developer of HubSpot for woocommerce integration.

to track attribution of sale, you have to use the tracking script and the easiest way to have - enable non-HubSpot form tracking on HubSpot, this will create a contact on checkout form submission with ads data in source drilldown.
<@UCH1L597V> thank you so much, that makes a lot of sense. Thanks again
